about.description:
pycroscopy is a python package for image processing and scientific analysis
of imaging modalities such as multi-frequency scanning probe microscopy,
scanning tunneling spectroscopy, x-ray diffraction microscopy, and transmission
electron microscopy. pycroscopy uses a data-centric model wherein the raw data
collected from the microscope, results from analysis and processing routines
are all written to standardized hierarchical data format (HDF5) files for
traceability, reproducibility, and provenance.
about.summary: Utilities for scientific analysis of nanoscale imaging data

name: pycroscopy
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pyCroscopy" %}
{% set version = "0.60.3" %}
{% set sha256 = "9db4a223a162aa8dabed2948b625e06f27b9ba99f99ea40f3b0ffc2fce8fdfcf" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name|lower }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"

requirements:
  build:
    - python
    - pip
    - pytest-runner
  run:
    - python
    - numpy_groupies ==0.9.7
    - pyqtgraph >=0.10
    - h5py >=2.6.0
    - igor
    - matplotlib >=2.0.0
    - scikit-learn >=0.17.1
    - xlrd >=1.0.0
    - joblib >=0.11.0
    - psutil
    - scikit-image >=0.12.3
    - scipy >=0.17.1
    - numpy >=1.13.0
    - ipywidgets >=5.2.2
    - ipython >=5.1.0,<6  # [py2k]  # IPython 6.0+ does not support Python 2.6, 2.7, 3.0, 3.1, or 3.2
    - ipython >=6  # [py3k]  # Beginning with IPython 6.0, Python 3.3 and above is required.
    - pyqt >=5  # [py3k]
    - six
    - pyusid
    - gwyfile
    - unittest2  # [py27]

test:
  imports:
    - pycroscopy

about:
  home: https://github.com/pycroscopy/pycroscopy
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Utilities for scientific analysis of nanoscale imaging data'
  description: |
    pycroscopy is a python package for image processing and scientific analysis
    of imaging modalities such as multi-frequency scanning probe microscopy,
    scanning tunneling spectroscopy, x-ray diffraction microscopy, and transmission
    electron microscopy. pycroscopy uses a data-centric model wherein the raw data
    collected from the microscope, results from analysis and processing routines
    are all written to standardized hierarchical data format (HDF5) files for
    traceability, reproducibility, and provenance.
  doc_url: https://pycroscopy.github.io/pycroscopy/index.html
  dev_url: https://github.com/pycroscopy/pycroscopy

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - carlodri
    - ssomnath
    - compphyschris
